bestBHT.bht: Those who reject God's message will be cast into the furnace of fire, as described in the verse. This vivid imagery conveys the seriousness and irreversibility of their judgment. The use of the same language as another verse intensifies the impact, highlighting the grave nature of the situation. The furnace of fire symbolizes the eternal punishment awaiting those who reject God's truth, serving as a stark reminder of the dire consequences that come with rejecting His grace and salvation.

Philip Schaff: Repeats word for word the awful language of Matthew 13:42, giving great solemnity to the close of the discourse in parables.
The historical application is obviously to the closing period and scene of the Church militant.

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse in question speaks of those who reject God's message being cast into the furnace of fire. This imagery is used to emphasize the severity and finality of the judgment that awaits them. The use of this language in Matthew 13:50 echoes the earlier verse, Matthew 13:42, further intensifying the gravity of the situation. The mention of the furnace of fire symbolizes the eternal punishment that awaits those who refuse to accept God's truth. It serves as a sobering reminder of the consequences that result from rejecting God's grace and salvation.
